source.3cd443cd:
plt.figure(figsize=(12,6))
plt.title('Density plot for song duration')
sns.kdeplot(train.song_duration_ms[train['song_popularity'] == 0], color="red", shade=True)
sns.kdeplot(train.song_duration_ms[train['song_popularity'] == 1], color="blue", shade=True)
plt.grid()
plt.legend(['False','True'])
plt.show()
source.000df1ef:
import numpy as np
plt.figure(figsize=(10,10))
corr_matrix=train.corr()
mask = np.zeros_like(corr_matrix)
mask[np.triu_indices_from(mask)] = True
sns.heatmap(corr_matrix, mask=mask, square=True)
plt.show()

source.a9929f7c:
plt.figure(figsize=(8,10))
plt.scatter(train.energy[train['song_popularity'] == 0], train.acousticness[train['song_popularity'] == 0], s=10, c='red')
plt.scatter(train.energy[train['song_popularity'] == 1], train.acousticness[train['song_popularity'] == 1], s=10, c='blue')
plt.grid()
plt.legend(['False','True'])
plt.xlabel('Energy')
plt.ylabel('Acousticness')
plt.show()
source.ba94da13: We load a range of libraries for general data wrangling and general visualisation together with more specialised tools.
source.f9504326:
This challenge is about predicting Song Popularity based on a set of different features.

The data consists of the standard Kaggle `train.csv` and `test.csv` files, with a sample_submission.csv to show you the structure of the file that should be submitted.
